repository.label: Repository

did.abstract: Letters, 1861, of E. J. Humphries while at Camp Davis, Lynchburg, Virginia; a letter, 1869, from an Augusta, Georgia, commission merchant to Humphries.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: E. J. Humphries letters, 1861-1869, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: E. J. Humphries, a member of the Governor's Horse Guards; resident of Milledgevllle, Georgia.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters, 1861, of E. J. Humphries while at Camp Davis, Lynchburg, Virginia; a letter, 1869, from an Augusta, Georgia, commission merchant to Humphries.
